H0.text: The name of which chemical element, with the symbol 'Tc', is derived from the Greek for 'artificial'. Technetium

H1.text: The name of which chemical element, with the symbol 'Tc', is derived from the Greek for 'artificial'. Technicium

H2.text: The name of which chemical element, with the symbol 'Tc', is derived from the Greek for 'artificial'. Artificium

H3.text: The name of which chemical element, with the symbol 'Tc', is derived from the Greek for 'artificial'. Danubium

A4.text: In 1947, element 43 was named after the Greek word technetos (τεχνητός), meaning 'artificial', since it was the first element to be artificially produced.

A5.text: hence its name (from the Greek technetos, 'artificial', + -ium)
